Document on mass killings in Rogun-ri opened to public 
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- A document of the U.S. government's side has been recently opened to the public, Seoul-based MBC reported. It proves mass killings committed by the U.S. imperialist aggressors in Rogun-ri, Yongdong county, North Chungchong Province, South Korea, during the Korean War.
 The document says that the U.S. air force made a strafing at Rogun-ri area for two days from July 26, 1950.    
 This document which was opened to the public by reporters of AP which was the first to report about the Rogun-ri case, refuted the results of the final investigation of the U.S. forces side that there was no aerial attack on Rogun-ri in those days.    This once again proves victims' testimonies that refugees there were strafed in those days were truth.

articles.content:
Anachronistic U.S.-toeing policy under fire
    Pyongyang, August 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Kamal Kharrazi on his reappointment as foreign minister of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries, the message wished him greater success in his work.
